drupalNodeEvent.title: The CCP Faces a Second Undulation of the Democracy Movement

field_description.processed: In the 1980s intellectuals sought democratization in China by trying to influence the highest levels of government, but in the end the 1989 massacre practically closed that door. About a decade later, from the early 2000s until 2008, an effort with similar goals, and some of the same leaders, grew from the opposite endâ€”from the bottom up, by using the Internet to gather popular support for reformist causes.
